body.p: To his Excelency B Magoffin Gov of Ky

yer Petitioner Lewis Hark states that on the 18th day of aprile last he was tried before a in this county for a breach of the peace and find $12.00 and cost all amountg to $16.62 ^fir which fifa ^ he stats that he is a very poor man & compelled to labor dayly for asupport and that the difficulty wasthat took place was between him and a man named Allen Haggered who was entoxicated and provoked him to strike consequently he was fond guilty of a Breach of the Peace and fined as above stated he thinks under all the circumstances that he ought to be released from said fines and pray that your Exelency will through humanity will grant it
we the undersigned citizens of this County state the facts stated in the forgoing petition are true & that your petitioner is a fit person for Executive Clemency

Jno. F. Higgins
S M Johnston
Joshua Curtis
E Harp
Personally appeard before me the undersgn a Justice of the Peace for said county Lewis Hark who made oath that the facts statemnts made in the foregoing petition are true
Given under my hand this 26th day of May 1862
S. E. Higgins J p l c
Please send to me or F Higgins at Crab Orchard Ky

Lincoln J P Ct
$12. } Breach
Lewis Harp
Remission Isd
June 9. 1862
